name: Mariano Hotel

reviews.text: The staff were very pleasant and helpful and the rooms, while definitely not of a high standard (and extremely small!), were clean and the beds were comfortable - good enough when you're out sightseeing all day.
reviews.title: not 3 star

likes.liked: — located right near the train station
likes.disliked: — noise from other rooms - the walls are very thin!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The main problem was the lack of water pressure. Showers were a matter of 'catch the drops' and as mentioned by another reviewer, the shower curtain is completely inadequate in keeping what little water came out from flooding the rest of the bathroom.
reviews.title: What a dump!

likes.liked: — The building has some interesting history
likes.disliked: — It was hot and stuffy, dirty, rude staff members, shall I continue?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I wouldn't recommend this hotel during summer since there didn't seem to be any way to cool the room down, otherwise, it's a reasonably priced place to sleep while you stay at Rome. Breakfast was average - unfortunately they give you powdered milk.
reviews.title: Excellent Service

likes.liked: — The service, the staff and the great breakfasts
likes.disliked: — the lift broke down - not a fault of the hotel, but just one of those things

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent one night here after our cruise. The travel agent called it a 3-star hotel and we certainly paid enough for a luxury hotel but got neither. The room was large for a European hotel but the decor was garish. The mattress was thin and lumpy. The sheets were thin with cigarette burns and holes. The bath tub had mold. The shower curtain was only about half the length of the tub. The floor needed to be swept. There were no real chairs in the room, just a low wooden bench and a stool that went to the desk (which couldn't be used because it was the TV stand). The room had a high ceiling but was still hot and stuffy.
reviews.title: Loved it- would stay there again

reviews.text: One desk clerk was helpful with tour information. The later desk clerk (whom we caught drinking on the job) was not helpful after we were robbed on the subway. We needed information and assistance with the telephone, but he insisted he could not help us. Later when we had info from the US Embassy, he asked if he could have a copy. After this we heard him recommend the subway to a young couple with no warning about thieves.
reviews.title: Not Three Stars But Close to the Termini

reviews.text: This hotel was terrible. It is located on the dodgy side of the Termini train station where graffiti is sprayed on buildings and the streets are rough. We were frightened walking during the daytime! The room was a disgrace , thankgoodness we only needed a bed for the night. The noise coming from the children and neighbours next door was easily heard through the walls til late. I did not like the fact matches were left on the bed , an easy way for children to start a fire. Breakfast was of a very poor standard , stale cereal , just dreadful. Do not stay here.
reviews.title: Not a 3 star

reviews.text: Stayed at Hotel Mariano on 9/28 and 9/29/05. After reading the reviews, my husband and I (both 29 yrs old) were very skeptical as the reviews for this hotel seemed extreme. However, I will provide the facts and you can decide what may be important to you.
reviews.title: Detailed Description- You Choose
Exceeded Expectations
reviews.text: We booked through a name your own price website for $143USD per night. Therefore, the room was booked as two people in single beds. After requesting a double, the accomodating staff (who may be the owner) put us into a room with one double and one single facing the street. The hotel did have an elevator. The satff spoke very good English and were very friendly.

reviews.title: Do not stay here!!
reviews.text: We found that the wallpaper was peeling. The bathroom had a strong oder of bleech. The sheets and towels were clean and white. The water was hot and included a hand held shower with ability to hang on the wall. No wires...electrically sound. AC had already been removed from the windows for the season. The room had a 15" colored tv and telephone in the room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: heplful & kind in a big city....rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Bargain Hotel close to Train Station...

likes.liked: — Front desk service, room size, proximity to the train station

reviews.title: Easily accessible, basic but we loved it!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Decent for the price!

reviews.text: We just returned from a 10 day trip to Italy. This hotel is a tough to review because it serves itself well. Italy hotels are what they are...small and simple. Don't expect that rockin' bed and shower you had at the Westin in Fort Lauderdale last trip, etc, unless you are ready to pay a very hefty price for it.
reviews.title: If you need a place to sleep...

reviews.text: Our room was clean, quiet and the bathroom seemed to be brand new. The staff was helpful and willing. The bed was firm and the pillows are very very thin as they were at all the hotels during our stay. If you want to stay near the Termini, there are plenty of hotels in the area that would make you feel more comfortable. We dined on Amadeo a few nights and the walk was straight down to the hotel. The last two blocks you have to walk are seedy and the area around the Piazza smells of urine and is lined with trash cans. If I'm on a trip with some buddies in Rome, yes I'd stay at this hotel. If you are not a city person then do not as the last few blocks may have you looking over your shoulder. Stay further up the street.
reviews.title: good little hotel
Good Value
reviews.text: Location to Termini is fantastic and the major tourist bus routes originate there. The restaurant right next to the hotel is fantastic and very well priced.

I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The location is great although the surrounding area is grotty but busy at all times so there is no need to feel unsafe. I was travelling in a group of 3 females and we felt safe at all times. Pickpocketing is big in rome so as long as you keep your bags close to you at all times you should be fine. The room was really big and clean and the bathroom was great. The staff at the front desk were helpful too. The only negative I have about the hotel is that the breakfast was not very good.
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights at the conclusion of our Italian 3 week adventure. Hotel staff could not have been more friendly. Nothing was too much trouble. The room was a double, very large, clean yet very plain.
reviews.title: Could have been better for a 3 star but OK

description: Hotel set in former Italian Officers Quarters dating from 1880 offers modern comfort; located near Santa Maria Maggiore Basilica.
